result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce D. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before 2/1/2015.  DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided in another matter.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bruce D. Jones in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Klopp states matter is resolved and states recs.  DE agrees as does State.  Atty Klopp notes DE will waive his right to prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State files information.  Atty Klopp acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and pleads NC to Ct 1.  Court advises DE of charges/maximum penalties.  DE agrees to plea of NC.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  Atty Klopp makes statement.  Parties discuss stricken domestic abuse portion as that wouldn't apply in this matter.  Court so orders.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  NC
7 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 2/1/2015 at 6:00 pm
10 days credit to be applied
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
Cash bond to be applied w/balance being refunded to whomever posted it
Cts 2-4:  Dismissed/read-in
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bruce D. Jones in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Hearing set today to address possible dismissal of repeater allegations.  Atty Klopp states status.  There was confusion as he and his client never received the amended complaint and there was never an initial appearance on the amended complaint.  State is in agreement.  Court notes from his memory that the State thought the amended complaint would've been provided to Atty Klopp in the usual manner.  State states the remedy would be to put the DE back into the pre-prelim stage and they can again request a prelim.  Atty Klopp state they will request another prelim.  At this time Atty Klopp acknowledges rec. amended complaint, waives reading and requests prelim.  Time limits continued waived.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No violent/abusive contact w/K.W.; Absolute Sobriety; No contact w/DC; DAC, XSB; TLJ; KW
Motion hearing on October 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Bruce D. Jones in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:40 a.m. Motion to modify bond and dismiss enhancer.  Atty. Klopp states victim will testify on behalf of DE to modify bond.  State objects to modification.  K.W. sworn in & testifies.  State cross examine witness.  Atty. Klopp requests to lift no contact and gives some history.  State explains objection and history of DE.  Court lifts no contact w/KW but not the others.   Motion to dismiss enhancer - Atty. Klopp makes argument.  Court states an amended complaint was filed 5/29/14, DE states never recv'd amended complaint w/repeater allegations.  Atty. Klopp makes argument should not have gone to prelimnary hearing w/o recv'ing amendment and having intial.   Court gives both parties time to research.  Court resets matter for argument to go further.
